column4: the only media my computers could play was .mod until i was 14 or so back in 1997
I had a 486 till about 2 years back
well, my dad introduced me to Windows 95 on a 486 in 96, got a 686 in '05, and only upgraded our RAM (from 8 MB to 40 MB) and our modem (from 14.4 k/s to 56.6 k/s)
i've done that 2-3 times now. same story
but, I want to know if it's a floppy problem first
the best formatting method for a floppy is "dd if=/dev/null of=/dev/fd0 & mkfs.vfat /dev/fd0"
i tried to do a sudo cp <file> /mnt/floppy
put it in DOS, and find out, they must've gone faulty
they go faulty once i try to write anything to them in linux. when i reformat them in dos, they're perfectly fine
people in another channel are telling me i should have a /dev/fd0u1440
